definition: to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
(negative prefix)/not/no
bits/fragments/crumbs/filings/trifling/trivial/to condescend to
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

sentences.english: He shrug his low opinion of the occupant of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他耸耸肩表示对那房间的住户不屑一顾。
他对我的提议不屑一顾。

sentences.english: Hume heaps scorn on his contractarian idea.
sentences.chinese: 休谟对他的契约论不屑一顾。

sentences.english: In Asia and America it has become fashionable to look upon these failings with disdain.
sentences.chinese: 在亚洲和美国，不屑一顾于欧洲的衰落已经蔚然成风。

sentences.english: I remember feeling disdain for this collection of ogling humanity.
sentences.chinese: 对于许多人捕风捉影的收集，我感到不屑一顾。

sentences.english: Most Ken forget the ancients poem. The disdain is missing.
sentences.chinese: 最肯忘却古人诗，最不屑一顾是相思。

sentences.english: I only went down there to commiserate, and he was very dismissive.
sentences.chinese: 没错，我去是为了表示同情，但他却不屑一顾。

sentences.english: If they blow it, it could be their last chance.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们不屑一顾，这将是他们最后的机会。

sentences.english: Even a worldwide atlas shrugging will be interpreted several ways.
sentences.chinese: 甚至会有世界范围内的不屑一顾。

sentences.english: He disdains corporate politics and promotes people based on merit rather than seniority.
sentences.chinese: 他对公司政治不屑一顾，超越年龄限制按才取人。

sentences.english: But everyone was scornful to it.
Her parents stood undiminished and unware of criticism.
sentences.chinese: 她父母亲一如既往，对别人的批评不屑一顾。

sentences.english: Many scorn the internet as a plaything for plebs.
sentences.chinese: 良多公司对网络不屑一顾，以为那是一般民众的消遣。

sentences.english: Love is when a sexy woman walks past and you don't even notice.
sentences.chinese: 爱是当性感女郎从你身边经过时你不屑一顾。

sentences.english: He dismissed the president's claims of a bi-partisan approach.
sentences.chinese: 他对奥巴马呼吁的两党合作不屑一顾。

sentences.english: He is above the insincere flattery.
sentences.chinese: 他对这种假惺惺的谄谀不屑一顾。

definition: to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to despise/to look down upon/despicable
not to mind/unconcerned
to loathe/to despise/contempt
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
to contempt/to disdain/pejorative
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to turn a blind eye to
to pay no attention to/not to mind
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
to look down upon/to despise
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
